label.name: Introduction
label.description: Narrative description for set. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the set.

label.name: Item description
label.description: Narrative description for item in this set. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the item in the context of this set.

label.name: Presentation type
label.description: Determines how set is rendered when displayed to the public in the Pawtucket/Pawtucket2 front-end.

label.name: Is primary item for set?
label.description: The item marked as primary will be used to represent the set as a whole when included in a list of sets.

label.name: Chronology element code
label.description: Element code of date range element to be used when placing set items into chronological order.

label.name: Authorization date
label.description: The date when the loan was authorized.

label.name: Loan in date
label.description: The date a loan will enter the institution.

label.name: Loan in date
label.description: The date a loan will enter the institution.

label.name: Loan return date
label.description: The date a loan is due back to the lending institution.

label.name: Loan renewal application date
label.description: The date to apply for a renewal to the loan.

label.name: Loan conditions
label.description: A statement of the conditions on a loan.

label.name: Loan note
label.description: General information about the loan.

label.name: Loan purpose
label.description: General information about the purpose of loan.

label.name: Movement method
label.description: The method used in the movement of an object.

label.name: Movement note
label.description: Additional information about the movement of an object or group of objects.

label.name: Planned removal date
label.description: The date an object is to be removed from its current location.

label.name: Planned removal date
label.description: The date an object was actually removed from its current location.

label.name: Reason for move
label.description: The purpose or reason for the movement of the object or group of objects.

label.name: Introduction
label.description: Narrative description for tour. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the tour.

label.description: Narrative description for tour. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the tour.

label.name: Introduction
label.description: Narrative description for tour stop. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the stop.

label.name: Introduction
label.description: Narrative description for tour stop. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the stop.

label.name: Introduction
label.description: Narrative description for tour stop. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the stop.

label.name: Inledning
label.description: Berättande beskrivning av turen. Detta är den primära texten som används när turen presenteras.

label.description: Location of this stop.

label.name: Description
label.description: An account of the resource.

label.name: Caption
label.description: Short descriptive caption for item.

label.name: Notes (internal use only)
label.description: Notes regarding item

label.name: Length
label.description: Length of object; enter in your preferred units (eg. 10cm)

label.name: Width
label.description: Width of object; enter in your preferred units (eg. 10cm)

label.name: Height
label.description: Height of object; enter in your preferred units (eg. 10cm)

label.name: Depth
label.description: depth of object; enter in your preferred units (eg. 10cm)

label.name: Weight
label.description: Weight of object; enter in your preferred units

label.name: Dates
label.description: A point or period of time associated with an event in the life cycle of the resource.

label.name: Object nature
label.description: Nature of object (was object status in original Passage</i> database)

label.name: Does the object contain a chemical?
Check this box if you hold the copyright for this item
Description
label.description: Narrative biography for entity. This is the primary text used to document the entity.

label.name: Source of description
label.description: Source of entity biography. This should be a formal citation if possible. For informal sources a narrative description is acceptable.

label.name: Date founded
label.description: Date organization was founded.

label.name: Date incorporated
label.description: Date organization was incorporated.

label.name: Date of liquidation
label.description: Date organization was liquidated.

label.name: Brand names
label.description: Brand names under which the organization operated.

label.name: Manufacturer
label.description: Company that manufactured this artifact.

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Coordinates documenting the location of the item

settings.setting: Please list details of the culturally insensitive material.
If checked "yes": Please note all details of the firearm in the Record Restriction field below. Not sure? Check Standards.
If checked "yes": Please note all details of dangerous materials in the Condition Remarks of the Condition field below. Not sure? Check Standards.

Condition Date: Date that a condition was assessed.

Condition Examiner Name: Who did the condition assessment.

Condition Remarks: Comments on the condition.

Current Condition Description: Description of the object’s condition.Include all details of dangerous materials in the Condition Remarks.
If checked "yes": Please note all details of dangerous materials in the Condition Remarks of the Condition field below. Not sure? Check Standards.

Conservation Treatment: Description of treatment from Conservator.

Conservator Name: Name of conservator who did the work.

Conservation Treatment Date: Date of treatment.

Conservator Remarks: Comments from the conservator. Please include all details of any dangerous materials in this field.
Please note any Legal Restrictions in this field.
If checked "yes": Enter all details in the Record Restrictions field. Not sure? Check Standards.
Firearm? Please Check Standards and include all details on the "Rights" screen.
Do you have a Gift Agreement form completed to support the donation of this object?
A unique alpha-numeric identifier for this object. Typically in the format of 2015.001.001. Look in your artifact log to see which is the next one that you would use.
Please choose a standardized title from Chenhall.
Alternate standardized title from Chenhall or a colloquial title. For artwork this might be the artwork’s title.
Please choose from this drop down box based on Chenhall
Please choose from this drop down box based on Chenhall.
A description of the maker’s marks, labels associated with the object, or inscriptions.
Date that object was created, manufactured, or formed.
Materials that this object is made out of. Listed from most to least predominant.
List the support material used for this object. This field is used primarily for artwork and photographs. Ie. Canvas.
Please list the object’s measurements. In either Imperial or Metric. Be sure to include what measurements you used.
How many components does this object have? Please list the names of component parts.
Methods, processes, or materials used to create a two-dimensional object. Ie. Oil, Pencil, Pastel.
Processes, methods, or techniques used to create this object. Ie. Carved, woven, hand blown.
Identification, description, or interpretation of what is depicted in and by a work or image: ie. Love, Marriage, Confederation.
Provide a few details about the form and location of the artist’s or maker’s signature on the object.
Name of the historical period associated with this artifact.
School and/or stylistic associations for this object. Ie Cubist, Canadian, French Colonial.
The Manufacturer’s brand name for the object. Ie Cheerios or Imperial Brand.
Choose from the list colours that this object is.
Branch of learning that this object might fall into. Ie Medicine, Agriculture.
Information regarding the various and historical and/or military associations of this object, including the country, event, individual, or theatre of war.
Reference numbers for photographs of the object.
The manufacturer’s model name and/or number for the object.
Name of the individual or manufacturer who created the object.
Name of the individual, institution or business that had custody of the object immediately before it was acquired by the institution
Please check this box if the object has been deaccessioned. Type: How was the object removed from the collection?
Tell us what happened to this object? Why is it important?
What reference materials did you use for your research of this object?
What exhibitions has this object been in?
What country was this object used in?
Do you know who the original owner was?
What place was this object used in?

Series/Volume Publisher: Name of the publisher of the book, portfolio, or series that incorporates the object.

Series/Volume Title: Title or name of the book, portfolio, or series that incorporates the object.

Series/Volume Author: Name of the author of the book, portfolio, or series that incorporates the object.

Series/Volume Number: Relationship of the object to the book, portfolio, or series that incorporates the object. Ie No. 421, Figure 79.

Series/Volume Place: Location of the publisher for the book, portfolio, or series that incorporates the object.

Series/Volume Date: Date of the publication of the book, portfolio, or series that incorporates the object.
Place the Borden Number here, which is an archaeological assigned number for the location of the object; such as GbTo-23.

role.name: Administrators
role.description: Confers actions needed by those administering the system

role.name: Cataloguers
role.description: Confers actions needed by those editing catalogue entries

role.name: Researcher
role.description: Allows users to only search and view - but not edit - catalogue entries

role.name: User content moderator
role.description: Allows users to moderate user generated tags and comments

group.description: Users who can add and edit catalogue entries
